description: T(n,3,1), where T(n,k,s) with 0<=s<n is the number of sequences a_1,...,a_(k*n+s) of integers 0,1,...,n such that the 'bumped' sequence b_1,...,b_(k*n+s) has exactly s n's, where b_i=a_i + j (mod n+1) with minimal j>=0 such that b_0,...,b_i contain at most k elements equal to b_i.
references: I. A. Blake and A. G. Konheim, Big buckets are (are not) better!, J. ACM, 24 (1977), 591-606.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
mathematica: T[k_, m_] := T[k, m] = If[m <= k, 1, Module[{n = Quotient[m, k]}, Sum[Binomial[m - 1, k i - 1] i T[k, k i - 1]T[k, m - k i], {i, 1, n}] + If[n k == m, 0, (n + 1)T[k, m - 1]]]]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: More terms and better description from Reiner Martin (reinermartin(AT)hotmail.com), Feb 07 2002
